newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent stagnant before weekend, contango widens.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent stagnant before weekend, contango widens.

text.p: IPE Brent futures were unmoved in quiet trade at midsession as the market nudged back and forth in a tight range before the weekend and next week's OPEC meeting.
August Brent was two cents lower at $17.76 a barrel by 1115 GMT, but its contango to September widened by about eight cents to nearly 20 cents. July gas oil was level at $159.50 a tonne.
Brokers said technicals were determining price movements in a market bereft of news. They cited a tight trading range with support at $17.68 and resistance at $17.98.
But a break from that range could spark a major move, with players relieved to break off the constraints of current levels.
"I can see the market will get a bit bored with these levels and you've got the risk of any move out of the range being big and violent," one broker said.
The expiry of the NYMEX July contract at the close on Friday was seen as a possible catalyst of a move.
Brokers said the market would probably get jittery before the meeting of OPEC ministers in Vienna on June 25.
But they were not expecting any drastic news from the 11-member cartel and said it would probably just "roll over" the current production quota.
Trade in gas oil was thin and the levels unchanged, though dealers said the market looked negative below key support at $160.00
